reviews.text: Awefull information boards been broken for months never get fixed, lots of trains cancelled late notice, buy customers still pay same prices :(

Busy station with good direct connections to Manchester, Liverpool, Warrington, Chester and North Wales. 
Interesting history to the station too. It as the oldest railway station building in the world at a used station. Great sham
e you can't go in though.

A dank station

It's a shame that I never get time to go on the trains :(

In all seriousness, step-free access is an issue but platforms 1 and 5 are accessible. There are services to and from Wales on platforms 4	and 5 and trains from Liverpool to Manchester and vice versa on Platforms 1 and 2	 and trains to and from Liverpool to Warrington Bank Quay on Platform 3
Busy Friday market and interesting Saturday flea market, plus good choices for places to eat and drink.

Local station with services to Manchester, Liverpool, Warrington and Chester all of which are stopper services. Station has a ticket office, next train boards and undercover seating.
Station lacks accessibility to platforms 2,3 and 4 as there are steps. A long walk is expected for those needing accessible walkways from platform 1 to platform 5.
Careful if your on an Arriva Trains Wales train as there's quite a step between the train and the platform (platform4 and 5). Also a step on platform 3.
